Item.sqlserver_body: /* name: business_calendar Created: 10-JAN-2006 George J. Carrette Note: the overhead of an innovator defined table is about 1kbyte per row, which would negatively impact runtime performance. The table defined here doesn't really need an ID column given how it is used by the rest of the code, but the ID column does help the dbdiff utility we use to understand what is going on with the data. */ BEGIN CREATE TABLE BUSINESS_CALENDAR (DAY_DATE SMALLDATETIME NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, DAY_NUMBER INTEGER NOT NULL, ID CHAR(32) NOT NULL) CREATE INDEX [I0] ON BUSINESS_CALENDAR (DAY_NUMBER) CREATE UNIQUE INDEX [I1] ON BUSINESS_CALENDAR (ID) END
Item.name: business_calendar
